route-static-urpf-enable.description: Enable/disable the static user route static URPF (Unicast Reverse Path Forwarding) function.

icmp-ignore-hostcar.description: Enable/disable the static user icmp ignore hostcar function.

detect-interval.description: Configure the interval at which the device detects whether static users are online.

name.description: Specify the static user interface-list name.

ipv4-users.description: List of static user for IPv4.

ipv4-user.description: Configure a static user for IPv4, the number of addresses between start IPv4 addresse and end IPv4 addresse cannot exceed 256, YANG does not support the combination and splitting of keys in consecutive address segments. The start IP address must be equal or less than the end IP address. The start IP address and end IP address must belong to some IP address pool with the configured VPN instance. They must be configured as excluded addresses and cannot be automatically assigned.

end-ip-address.description: Specify an end IP address. If this parameter is not specified, this command configures only one layer 2 static user.

vpn-name.description: Specify a VPN instance name. Public network vpn-name value is '_public_'.

up-backup-interface.description: Specify a UP backup interface name. The UP backup interface and the main interface must belong to same UP backup group. The UP backup interface cannot be modified or deleted independently.

interface-list.description: Specify the static user interface-list name.

vlan-id.description: Specify a VLAN ID. The corresponding VLAN ID has been configured on the interface.

mac-address.description: Indicates MAC addresses. If this parameter is specified, it applies only to one layer 2 static user.

detect-enable.description: Enable/disable the device to detect whether the configured layer 2 static user is online. If this parameter is not configured, IPv4 users are triggered to go online only when ARP/IPv4 packets are sent.

qinq-vlan-id.description: Specify a QinQ VLAN ID. The corresponding VLAN ID has been configured on the interface.

export-enable.description: Enable/disable advertises host routes of a layer 2 static user.

gateway-ip-address.description: Specify a gateway address. The IPv4 gateway address must be the same as the address pool gateway address. IPv4 pool xpath: /bras-ipv4-address-manage:bras-ipv4-address-manage/bras-ipv4-address-manage:ipv4-pools/bras-ipv4-address-manage:ipv4-pool/bras-ipv4-address-manage:local/bras-ipv4-address-manage:gateway/bras-ipv4-address-manage:gate-ip or /bras-ipv4-address-manage:bras-ipv4-address-manage/bras-ipv4-address-manage:ipv4-pools/bras-ipv4-address-manage:ipv4-pool/bras-ipv4-address-manage:remote/bras-ipv4-address-manage:gateway/bras-ipv4-address-manage:gate-ip.

description.description: Specify a description for a layer 2 static user.

keep-online-enable.description: Enable/disable the device to retain the online status of the configured layer 2 static user even if user detection fails. This parameter is configured when firewalls exist on the network and detection packets cannot be sent out.

ipv6-users.description: List of static user for IPv6.

ipv6-user.description: Configure a static user for IPv6, the number of addresses between start IPv6 addresse and end IPv6 addresse cannot exceed 256, YANG does not support the combination and splitting of keys in consecutive address segments. The start IPv6 address must be equal or less than the end IPv6 address.

end-ipv6-prefix.description: Specify an end IPv6 delegation prefix. The start IPv6 delegation prefix must be equal or less than the end IPv6 delegation prefix.

prefix-length.description: Specify an IPv6 delegation prefix length.

dual-stack-users.description: List of static user for IPv4 and IPv6.

dual-stack-user.description: Configure a static user for IPv4 and IPv6, the number of addresses between start IP addresse and end IP addresse cannot exceed 256, YANG does not support the combination and splitting of keys in consecutive address segments.
